level.heading: DISAPPROVAL OF APPLICATION OR CANCELLATION OF PERMIT (§ 1-1402)

level.text: The Building Manager, FMD, shall disapprove any application or cancel an issued permit for use of a public area if the proposed use:
Involves an activity set forth in § 1401.5;
Obstructs the free entrance and exit of the users of the public area;
May result in damages to the public building or property within the public building;
May cause or disrupt the official business of the agency or agencies occupying the public building;
Interferes with the tenant’s quiet enjoyment of leasehold;
Interferes with a previously approved use of the public area by another member or members of the public;
Is obscene within the meaning of obscenity in 18 U.S.C. §§ 1461-1465;
Pertains to any judicial or quasi-judicial proceeding then pending in the public building and the use is intended to influence or impede that proceeding;
Is in violation of any law of the District of Columbia or the United States; or
Is being conducted with a permit obtained by submitting an intentionally false or incomplete application.
Upon disapproving an application or canceling an issued permit, the Building Manager, FMD, shall:
Promptly notify the applicant or permittee in writing of the reasons for disapproval or cancellation; and
Inform the applicant of his or her right to appeal the disapproval or cancellation to the Administrator, Facility Management Division (“FMD”), under § 1403.
